intro: Dalenia pubescens, commonly known as the hairy dalenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy yellow flowers with red veins, often clustered in inflorescences. Dalenia pubescens is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
